cards.name: Volunteer Militia
cards.flavor: People fight hardest on their own soil.

cards.name: Alaborn Zealot
cards.text: When Alaborn Zealot blocks a creature, destroy that creature and Alaborn Zealot.
cards.original_text: If Alaborn Zealot blocks, destroy both Alaborn Zealot and the creature it blocks. (Destroy both creatures before you deal damage.)

cards.name: Alaborn Trooper
cards.flavor:
"I dedicate my body to my country
And my life to my King."
—Alaborn Soldier's Oath

cards.name: Town Sentry
cards.text: Whenever Town Sentry blocks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"So he gots a sword. Big deal."
"Yeah, it's a big deal—it's a big sword!"
—Two goblins outside the gates of Trokin
cards.original_text: If Town Sentry blocks, it gets +0/+2 until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Temple Acolyte
cards.text: When Temple Acolyte enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: Young, yes. Inexperienced, yes. Weak? Don't count on it.
cards.original_text: When Temple Acolyte comes into play from your hand, you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Trokin High Guard
cards.flavor: Battle tempers soldiers as fire tempers steel.

cards.name: Wild Griffin
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Two little goblins, out in the sun. Down came a griffin, and then there was one.
cards.original_text: Flying

cards.name: Angelic Wall
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
cards.flavor: Be at peace, and observe its beauty. Be at war, and feel its justice.
cards.original_text:
Flying 
Walls can't attack.

cards.name: Alaborn Musketeer
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: Muskets gave the Alaborn army an advantage it had long lacked—air defense.
cards.original_text: Alaborn Musketeer can block creatures with flying.

cards.name: Angelic Blessing
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: The man who rose up to fight was not the same man knocked down.
cards.original_text: Any one creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Breath of Life
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.original_text: Take any one creature card from your graveyard and put that creature into play. Treat it as though you just played it from your hand.

cards.name: Path of Peace
cards.text: Destroy target creature. Its owner gains 4 life.
cards.flavor:
"You could die famous or you could die old. I chose old."
—Former soldier
cards.original_text: Destroy any one creature. That creature's owner gains 4 life.

rulings.text: You are a creature's owner if the card representing it began the game in your deck, or if it's a token that entered the battlefield under your control. If Path of Peace targets a creature that you own but an opponent controls, you'll gain 4 life.
If the target creature is an illegal target by the time Path of Peace tries to resolve, the spell doesn't resolve. No player gains life.

cards.name: Righteous Charge
cards.text: Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Bravery shines brightest in a pure soul."
—Restela, Alaborn marshal
cards.original_text: All your creatures get +2/+2 until the end of the turn.

rulings.text: Only creatures you control when Righteous Charge resolves will get +2/+2. Creatures that come under your control later in the turn will not.

cards.name: Festival of Trokin
cards.text: You gain 2 life for each creature you control.
cards.flavor: Everyone loves a good sale.
cards.original_text: For each creature you have in play, you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Angel of Mercy
cards.text:
Flying
When Angel of Mercy enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
cards.original_text:
Flying
When Angel of Mercy comes into play from your hand, you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Alaborn Cavalier
cards.text: Whenever Alaborn Cavalier attacks, you may tap target creature.
cards.flavor:
"Course he ran! I wouldn't want to stare down that barrel, either!"
—Alaborn soldier
cards.original_text: If Alaborn Cavalier attacks, you may choose to tap any one creature. (Tapped creatures can't block.)

cards.name: Temple Elder
cards.text: {T}: You gain 1 life. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.flavor:
"Give us breath. Give us life. Prepare us for the day we make."
—The Alaborn "Rite of Battle"
cards.original_text: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Temple Elder to gain 1 life.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.name: Alaborn Grenadier
cards.text: Vigilance
cards.flavor:
"Ever proud, ever vigilant."
—Grenadier motto
cards.original_text: Attacking doesn't cause Alaborn Grenadier to tap.

cards.name: Armored Griffin
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.original_text:
Flying
Attacking doesn't cause Armored Griffin to tap.

cards.name: Bargain
cards.text:
Target opponent draws a card.
You gain 7 life.
cards.flavor: Bargaining with a goblin is like trading with a child; both believe they already own everything.
cards.original_text:
Your opponent draws a card.
You gain 7 life.

cards.name: Rally the Troops
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Untap all creatures you control.
cards.original_text:
Play Rally the Troops only after you're attacked, before you declare blockers.
Untap all your creatures.

cards.name: Warrior's Stand
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.original_text:
Play Warrior's Stand only after you're attacked, before you declare blockers.
All your creatures get +2/+2 until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Vengeance
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.flavor: A bullet renders all sizes equal.
cards.original_text: Destroy any one tapped creature.

cards.name: Archangel
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.original_text:
Flying
Attacking doesn't cause Archangel to tap.

cards.name: Angel of Fury
cards.text:
Flying
When Angel of Fury dies, you may shuffle it into its owner's library.
cards.original_text:
Flying
If Angel of Fury is put into your graveyard from play, you may choose to shuffle Angel of Fury into your library.

rulings.text: If Angel of Fury is removed from the graveyard after the ability triggers but before it resolves, it will remain in its zone when its owner shuffles their library. Similarly, if a replacement effect has it move to a different zone instead of being put into the graveyard, the ability won't trigger at all.

Angel of Fury's second ability is a leaves-the-battlefield ability. Because it works only from on the battlefield, it behaves differently than the _Lorwyn_ Incarnations. When Angel of Fury is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, it will look back in time (to the point just before it left the battlefield) to see if its ability triggers. That means the following: — If Angel of Fury lost its triggered ability while on the battlefield (due to Snakeform, for example) and then was destroyed, the ability would not trigger. Angel of Fury would stay in its owner's graveyard. — If Angel of Fury had its triggered ability when it left the battlefield, but lost it when it was put into the graveyard (due to Yixlid Jailer, for example), the ability would still trigger. Angel of Fury would be shuffled into its owner's library.

cards.name: Alaborn Veteran
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.original_text: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Alaborn Veteran to give any one creature +2/+2 until the end of the turn.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.name: Steam Catapult
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.flavor: "You idiots! Turn it around! Turn it around!"
cards.original_text: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Steam Catapult to destroy any one tapped creature.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.name: Righteous Fury
cards.text: Destroy all tapped creatures. You gain 2 life for each creature destroyed this way.
cards.original_text: Destroy all tapped creatures. For each creature destroyed this way, you gain 2 life. (This includes your creatures.)

cards.name: Just Fate
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Destroy target attacking creature.
cards.original_text:
Play Just Fate only after you're attacked, before you declare blockers.
Destroy any one attacking creature.

cards.name: Armageddon
cards.text: Destroy all lands.
cards.flavor: War destroys more than just the land. War destroys hope.
cards.original_text: Destroy all lands. (This includes your lands.)

cards.name: Talas Scout
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"Scouting a battle before you fight it is just good business."
—Jefan, Talas ship captain
cards.original_text: Flying

cards.name: Talas Explorer
cards.text:
Flying
When Talas Explorer enters the battlefield, look at target opponent's hand.
cards.original_text:
Flying
When Talas Explorer comes into play from your hand, look at your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Screeching Drake
cards.text:
Flying
When Screeching Drake enters the battlefield, draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.original_text:
Flying
When Screeching Drake comes into play from your hand, draw a card, then choose and discard a card from your hand.

cards.name: Talas Air Ship
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"Their ships pollute our air as they themselves pollute our forest."
—Arathel, elvish queen
cards.original_text: Flying

cards.name: Talas Merchant
cards.flavor: The trader let loose a laugh that made all around him check their purses.

cards.name: Steam Frigate
cards.text: Steam Frigate can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
cards.flavor:
"Is it merchants or is it pirates?"
"It's Talas—there's no difference."
cards.original_text: Steam Frigate can't attack unless the defending player has an island in play.

cards.name: Touch of Brilliance
cards.text: Draw two cards.
cards.flavor: "I don't want what I don't have. I want more of what I do have."
cards.original_text: Draw two cards.

cards.name: Déjà Vu
cards.text: Return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: History is the study of repetition.
cards.original_text: Return any one sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Sleight of Hand
cards.text: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.
cards.original_text: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.

rulings.text: If there is only one card in your library, it goes to your hand.

cards.name: Wind Sail
cards.text: One or two target creatures gain flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: It pays to be at home both on the sea and in the sky.
cards.original_text: Any one or two creatures gain flying until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Tidal Surge
cards.text: Tap up to three target creatures without flying.
cards.flavor: Four little goblins, trapped by the sea. One teased a serpent, and then there were three.
cards.original_text: Tap any one, two, or three creatures without flying. (Tapped creatures can't block.)

cards.name: Time Ebb
cards.text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor:
"The ogre had come from out of the blue, so that's where I sent it back."
—Talas wizard
cards.original_text: Return any one creature from play to the top of its owner's library.

cards.name: False Summoning
cards.text: Counter target creature spell.
cards.original_text: Play False Summoning only in response to another player playing a creature. That creature card has no effect, and that player puts it into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Extinguish
cards.text: Counter target sorcery spell.
cards.original_text: Play Extinguish only in response to another player playing a sorcery. That sorcery has no effect, and that player puts it into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Apprentice Sorcerer
cards.text: {T}: Apprentice Sorcerer deals 1 damage to any target. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.original_text: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Apprentice Sorcerer to have it deal 1 damage to any one creature or player.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.name: Air Elemental
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: As insubstantial, and as powerful, as the wind that carries it.
cards.original_text: Flying

cards.name: Armored Galleon
cards.text: Armored Galleon can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
cards.flavor:
"Information equals profits. Our merchants sell it, or our pirates use it."
—Jefan, Talas ship captain
cards.original_text: Armored Galleon can't attack unless the defending player has an island in play.

cards.name: Eye Spy
cards.text: Look at the top card of target player's library. You may put that card into their graveyard.
cards.original_text: Look at the top card of any player's library. You may choose to put that card back on top of that library or into that player's graveyard.

cards.name: Sea Drake
cards.text:
Flying
When Sea Drake enters the battlefield, return two target lands you control to their owner's hand.
cards.original_text:
Flying
When Sea Drake comes into play from your hand, return any two of your lands from play to your hand.

rulings.text: When the ability resolves, if one of the lands has become an illegal target (because it's no longer on the battlefield, for example), you return the other one to your hand. If both of the lands have become illegal targets, the ability doesn't resolve. This has no effect on Sea Drake.

cards.name: Undo
cards.text: Return two target creatures to their owners' hands.
cards.original_text: Return any two creatures from play to their owner's hand. (You can't play Undo unless you can choose two creatures to return.)

rulings.text: The two creatures may have different owners and return to their respective owner's hands.

cards.name: Remove
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Return target attacking creature to its owner's hand.
cards.original_text:
Play Remove only after you're attacked, before you declare blockers.
Return any one attacking creature to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Mystic Denial
cards.text: Counter target creature or sorcery spell.
cards.original_text: Play Mystic Denial only in response to another player playing a creature or a sorcery. That card has no effect, and that player puts it into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Theft of Dreams
cards.text: Draw a card for each tapped creature target opponent controls.
cards.flavor: "First they fight, then they sleep, then they dream. And finally I receive my reward."
cards.original_text: For each tapped creature your opponent has in play, you draw a card.

cards.name: Coastal Wizard
cards.text: {T}: Return Coastal Wizard and another target creature to their owners' hands. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.original_text: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Coastal Wizard to return it and any one other creature to their owners' hands.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.name: Talas Warrior
cards.text: Talas Warrior can't be blocked.
cards.flavor: The sea is in their blood. Literally.
cards.original_text: Talas Warrior can't be blocked.

cards.name: Denizen of the Deep
cards.text: When Denizen of the Deep enters the battlefield, return each other creature you control to its owner's hand.
cards.original_text: When Denizen of the Deep comes into play from your hand, return all your other creatures from play to your hand.

cards.name: Talas Researcher
cards.text: {T}: Draw a card. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.flavor:
From time, knowledge.
From knowledge, power.
cards.original_text: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Talas Researcher to draw a card.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.name: Temporal Manipulation
cards.text: Take an extra turn after this one.
cards.flavor: Doing something at the last minute isn't so bad when you can make that minute last.
cards.original_text: You take another turn after this one.

rulings.text: If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

cards.name: Exhaustion
cards.text: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during their next untap step.
cards.original_text: At the beginning of your opponent's next turn, he or she skips untapping creatures and lands.

rulings.text: The creatures and lands are only prevented from untapping during the targeted player's next untap step. They can still can untap during other player's untap steps.
No creatures or lands controlled by the player will untap during their next untap step. This includes those which entered the battlefield after Exhaustion resolved.

cards.name: Piracy
cards.text: Until end of turn, you may tap lands you don't control for mana. Spend this mana only to cast spells.
cards.flavor: The sea gives, and the sea takes. Some just help with the taking.
cards.original_text: This turn, you may tap your opponent's lands to help pay for your spells.

cards.name: Muck Rats
cards.flavor:
"Just as some fool said it couldn't get worse, the rats began to show up."
—Alaborn soldier

cards.name: Dakmor Scorpion
cards.flavor: A scorpion this big you won't find curled up in your boot. Maybe around your boot, but not in it.

cards.name: Dakmor Bat
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: The bat thrives on what underestimates it.
cards.original_text: Flying

cards.name: Moaning Spirit
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: The dead sing their own lullabies.
cards.original_text: Flying

cards.name: Swarm of Rats
cards.text: Swarm of Rats's power is equal to the number of Rats you control.
cards.original_text: Swarm of Rats has power equal to the number of Rat cards you have in play. (This includes both tapped and untapped Rat cards.)

cards.name: Prowling Nightstalker
cards.text: Prowling Nightstalker can't be blocked except by black creatures.
cards.flavor: Silent as a serpent, twisted as a lone bog tree, evil as Tojira's heart.
cards.original_text: Prowling Nightstalker can't be blocked except by other black creatures.

cards.name: Lurking Nightstalker
cards.text: Whenever Lurking Nightstalker attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The shadows know.
cards.original_text: If Lurking Nightstalker attacks, it gets +2/+0 until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Raiding Nightstalker
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor:
"Our steeds need food, water, stabling. Theirs just need prey."
—Restela, Alaborn marshal
cards.original_text: Swampwalk (If defending player has any swamps in play, Raiding Nightstalker can't be blocked.)

cards.name: Ravenous Rats
cards.text: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
cards.original_text: When Ravenous Rats comes into play from your hand, your opponent chooses and discards a card from his or her hand. (Ignore this effect if your opponent doesn't have any cards.)

cards.name: Raise Dead
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor:
"Life from death is part of the natural cycle. This is merely a shortcut."
—Tojira, swamp queen
cards.original_text: Return any one creature from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.

cards.name: Cruel Edict
cards.text: Target opponent sacrifices a creature.
cards.flavor:
"Such a fragile organ, the brain."
—Tojira, swamp queen
cards.original_text: Your opponent chooses one of his or her creatures. Destroy that creature.

cards.name: Mind Rot
cards.text: Target player discards two cards.
cards.original_text: Your opponent chooses and discards two cards from his or her hand. (If your opponent has only one card, he or she discards it.)

cards.name: Hand of Death
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature.
cards.flavor: The touch of death is never gentle.
cards.original_text: Destroy any one creature that isn't black.

cards.name: Chorus of Woe
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: When nightstalkers sing, nothing in creation sleeps.
cards.original_text: All your creatures get +1/+0 until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Predatory Nightstalker
cards.text: When Predatory Nightstalker enters the battlefield, you may have target opponent sacrifice a creature.
cards.original_text: When Predatory Nightstalker comes into play from your hand, you may force your opponent to destroy any one of his or her creatures. (Your opponent chooses the creature.)

cards.name: Brutal Nightstalker
cards.text: When Brutal Nightstalker enters the battlefield, you may have target opponent discard a card.
cards.original_text: When Brutal Nightstalker comes into play from your hand, you may force your opponent to choose and discard a card from his or her hand.

cards.name: Abyssal Nightstalker
cards.text: Whenever Abyssal Nightstalker attacks and isn't blocked, defending player discards a card.
cards.original_text: If Abyssal Nightstalker attacks and isn't blocked, your opponent chooses and discards a card from his or her hand. (Ignore this effect if your opponent doesn't have any cards.)

rulings.text: An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

cards.name: Foul Spirit
cards.text:
Flying
When Foul Spirit enters the battlefield, sacrifice a land.
cards.original_text:
Flying
When Foul Spirit comes into play from your hand, destroy one of your lands.

cards.name: Dark Offering
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. You gain 3 life.
cards.flavor:
"Our greatest hope has become our enemy's greatest triumph."
—Restela, Alaborn marshal
cards.original_text: Destroy any one creature that isn't black. You gain 3 life.

cards.name: Coercion
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor:
"Human tenderness is simply weakness in a pretty package."
—Tojira, swamp queen
cards.original_text: Look at your opponent's hand and choose a card. Your opponent discards that card.

cards.name: Dakmor Plague
cards.text: Dakmor Plague deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor: The tiniest cough can be deadlier than the fiercest dragon.
cards.original_text: Dakmor Plague deals 3 damage to each creature and player. (This includes your creatures and you.)

cards.name: Kiss of Death
cards.text: Kiss of Death deals 4 damage to target opponent or planeswalker. You gain 4 life.
cards.flavor:
"I'd sooner lock lips with a viper. At least I might walk away from that."
—Elvish scout
cards.original_text: Kiss of Death deals 4 damage to your opponent. You gain 4 life.

cards.name: Bloodcurdling Scream
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"I have all the weapons my enemies have—and far deeper rage."
—Tojira, swamp queen
cards.original_text: Any one creature gets +X/+0 until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Hidden Horror
cards.text: When Hidden Horror enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a creature card.
cards.original_text: When Hidden Horror comes into play from your hand, choose and discard a creature card from your hand or destroy Hidden Horror.

rulings.text: When the ability resolves, you choose whether to sacrifice the creature or perform the other action. If you can't perform the other action, then you must sacrifice the creature.
If the creature is no longer on the battlefield when the ability resolves, you may still perform the action if you want.

cards.name: Vampiric Spirit
cards.text:
Flying
When Vampiric Spirit enters the battlefield, you lose 4 life.
cards.original_text:
Flying
When Vampiric Spirit comes into play from your hand, you lose 4 life. (The person who plays Vampiric Spirit loses the life.)

cards.name: Dakmor Sorceress
cards.text: Dakmor Sorceress's power is equal to the number of Swamps you control.
cards.original_text: Dakmor Sorceress has power equal to the number of swamp cards you have in play. (This includes both tapped and untapped swamp cards.)

cards.name: Nightstalker Engine
cards.text: Nightstalker Engine's power is equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
cards.flavor: Part metal, part bone, and all death.
cards.original_text: Nightstalker Engine has power equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.

cards.name: Return of the Nightstalkers
cards.text: Return all Nightstalker permanent cards from your graveyard to the battlefield. Then destroy all Swamps you control.
cards.original_text: Return all the Nightstalker cards from your graveyard to play. Then destroy all your swamps. (Treat these Nightstalkers as though they just came into play from your hand.)

cards.name: Ancient Craving
cards.text: You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.
cards.flavor:
"Knowledge demands sacrifice."
—Tojira, swamp queen
cards.original_text: Draw 3 cards. You lose 3 life.

cards.name: Rain of Daggers
cards.text: Destroy all creatures target opponent controls. You lose 2 life for each creature destroyed this way.
cards.flavor: Knives in the sky, cries in the air, and blood on the ground.
cards.original_text: Destroy all your opponent's creatures. For each creature destroyed this way, you lose 2 life.

cards.name: Raging Goblin
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.
cards.original_text: Raging Goblin is unaffected by summoning sickness.

cards.name: Goblin Piker
cards.flavor: Once he'd worked out which end of the thing was sharp, he was promoted to guard duty.

cards.name: Goblin Raider
cards.text: Goblin Raider can't block.
cards.flavor:
"I seen lots o' fights. To win ya gotta bash hard and not get bashed back."
—Goblin grunt
cards.original_text: Goblin Raider can't block.

cards.name: Goblin Glider
cards.text:
Flying
Goblin Glider can't block.
cards.flavor: The goblins call the gliders "death from above." Everyone else calls them "clods in the clouds."
cards.original_text:
Flying
Goblin Glider can't block.

cards.name: Goblin Mountaineer
cards.text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor: Goblin mountaineer, barely keeps his family fed.
cards.original_text: Mountainwalk (If defending player has any mountains in play, Goblin Mountaineer can't be blocked.)

cards.name: Ogre Berserker
cards.text: Haste
cards.flavor: The machine does the growling, so the ogre's free to smile.
cards.original_text: Ogre Berserker is unaffected by summoning sickness.

cards.name: Goblin Cavaliers
cards.flavor: They get along so well with their goats because they're practically goats themselves.

cards.name: Ogre Taskmaster
cards.text: Ogre Taskmaster can't block.
cards.flavor: Three little goblins, enjoying their brew. One bumped an ogre, and then there were two.
cards.original_text: Ogre Taskmaster can't block.

cards.name: Spitting Earth
cards.text: Spitting Earth deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
cards.original_text: Spitting Earth deals to any one creature damage equal to the number of mountains you have in play. (This includes both tapped and untapped mountains.)

cards.name: Stone Rain
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.flavor: There goes the neighborhood!
cards.original_text: Destroy any one land.

cards.name: Lava Axe
cards.text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: Meant to cut through the body and burn straight to the soul.
cards.original_text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to your opponent.

cards.name: Tremor
cards.text: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
cards.flavor: One little goblin shook up the ground. When the dust cleared, no one was found.
cards.original_text: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying. (This includes your creatures without flying.)

cards.name: Volcanic Hammer
cards.text: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Fire finds its form in the heat of the forge.
cards.original_text: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to any one creature or player.

cards.name: Goblin War Strike
cards.text: Goblin War Strike deals damage to target player or planeswalker equal to the number of Goblins you control.
cards.original_text: Goblin War Strike deals to your opponent damage equal to the number of Goblin cards you have in play. (This includes both tapped and untapped Goblin cards.)

cards.name: Ogre Arsonist
cards.text: When Ogre Arsonist enters the battlefield, destroy target land.
cards.original_text: When Ogre Arsonist comes into play from your hand, destroy any one land. (If you're the only one with lands, destroy one of them.)

cards.name: Goblin Matron
cards.text: When Goblin Matron enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
cards.original_text: When Goblin Matron comes into play from your hand, search your library for a Goblin card and put that card into your hand. Shuffle your library afterwards.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

You can search for any card with the creature type Goblin, including Creature or Tribal cards. Older cards of type "Summon Goblin" and "Summon Goblins" also count. You can't search for cards that have Goblin in the name but don't have the creature type Goblin.

cards.name: Ogre Warrior
cards.flavor: Assault and battery included.

cards.name: Goblin Firestarter
cards.text: Sacrifice Goblin Firestarter: It deals 1 damage to any target. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.original_text: On your turn, before you attack, you may destroy Goblin Firestarter to have it deal 1 damage to any one creature or player.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.name: Obsidian Giant
cards.flavor: After a while, ships stopped sailing within his reach.

cards.name: Blaze
cards.text: Blaze deals X damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"This isn't what I meant by 'facing the heat of battle!'"
—Jefan, Talas ship captain
cards.original_text: Blaze deals X damage to any one creature or player.

cards.name: Jagged Lightning
cards.text: Jagged Lightning deals 3 damage to each of two target creatures.
cards.original_text: Choose any two creatures. Jagged Lightning deals 3 damage to each of them. (You can't play Jagged Lightning unless you can choose two creatures to damage.)

cards.name: Goblin Lore
cards.text: Draw four cards, then discard three cards at random.
cards.flavor:
"I done forgot more than you'll ever know, pipsqueak."
"Yeah—that's your problem."
cards.original_text: Draw four cards and put them into your hand. Then discard three cards at random from your hand.

cards.name: Goblin War Cry
cards.text: Target opponent chooses a creature they control. Other creatures they control can't block this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Goblins cry, soldiers fly.
Stones fly, soldiers die!"
cards.original_text: Your opponent chooses one of his or her creatures. Only that creature can block this turn.

cards.name: Goblin General
cards.text: Whenever Goblin General attacks, Goblin creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Lead, follow, or run around like crazy.
cards.original_text: When Goblin General attacks, all your Goblins get +1/+1 until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Brimstone Dragon
cards.text: Flying, haste
cards.original_text:
Flying
Brimstone Dragon is unaffected by summoning sickness.

cards.name: Cunning Giant
cards.text: If Cunning Giant is unblocked, you may have it assign its combat damage to a creature defending player controls.
cards.original_text: If Cunning Giant attacks and isn't blocked, you may choose to have it deal its damage to any one of your opponent's creatures instead of to him or her.

cards.name: Magma Giant
cards.text: When Magma Giant enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.original_text: When Magma Giant comes into play from your hand, it deals 2 damage to each creature and player. (This includes you and your creatures, including Magma Giant.)

cards.name: Relentless Assault
cards.text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
cards.original_text: Untap all your creatures that attacked this turn. You may declare an additional attack this turn.

rulings.text: If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent's turn, that opponent's creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

cards.name: Earthquake
cards.text: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.
cards.original_text: Earthquake deals X damage to each player and each creature without flying. (This includes you and your creatures without flying.)

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature is without flying is only checked on resolution.

cards.name: Wildfire
cards.text: Each player sacrifices four lands. Wildfire deals 4 damage to each creature.
cards.original_text: You destroy four of your lands and your opponent destroys four of his or her lands. Then Wildfire deals 4 damage to each creature. (This includes your creatures.)

cards.name: Lynx
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: Rarely seen, hardly heard, never caught.
cards.original_text: Forestwalk (If defending player has any forests in play, Lynx can't be blocked.)

cards.name: Bear Cub
cards.flavor:
Every little cub has its mother's teeth to guard it.
—Elvish saying

cards.name: Lone Wolf
cards.text: You may have Lone Wolf assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
cards.original_text: If Lone Wolf attacks and is blocked, you may choose to have it deal its damage to the defending player instead of to the creatures blocking it.

rulings.text: You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the player or planeswalker this creature is attacking. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

cards.name: Norwood Riders
cards.text: Norwood Riders can't be blocked by more than one creature.
cards.flavor: "Trade my moose? Sure—when I find a horse that can spear ten goblins at a time!"
cards.original_text: Norwood Riders can't be blocked by more than one creature.

cards.name: Golden Bear
cards.flavor: The elvish scout was scrupulous about the truth. She told the traders that gold lay nearby.

cards.name: Plated Wurm
cards.flavor:
"I'd hate to see the bird that could get this wurm!"
—Alaborn soldier

cards.name: Norwood Archers
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor:
"'Air superiority?' Not while our archers scan the skies."
—Elvish scout
cards.original_text: Norwood Archers can block creatures with flying.

cards.name: Tree Monkey
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor:
"They serve the world best on a platter with shallots and onions."
—Talas sailor
cards.original_text: Tree Monkey can block creatures with flying.

cards.name: Norwood Warrior
cards.text: Whenever Norwood Warrior becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "The woods hold peace for those who desire it, but those who seek battle will find me."
cards.original_text: If Norwood Warrior attacks and is blocked, it gets +1/+1 until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Monstrous Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The nightstalkers' little game of tease-the-squirrel suddenly took an unexpected turn.
cards.original_text: Any one creature gets +4/+4 until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Salvage
cards.text: Put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.
cards.flavor:
"What was taken shall be restored."
—Arathel, elvish queen
cards.original_text: Take any one card from your graveyard and put that card on the top of your library.

cards.name: Nature's Lore
cards.text: Search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"Every seed planted is another lesson the forest can teach us."
—Arathel, elvish queen
cards.original_text: Search your library for a forest card and put that forest into play. Shuffle your library afterwards.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

You can find any card with the land type Forest, including Snow-covered Forest or non-Basic lands like Tropical Island, Murmuring Bosk, or Stomping Ground. You can even find a card that is a land in addition to other types, such as Dryad Arbor.

cards.name: Natural Spring
cards.text: Target player gains 8 life.
cards.flavor: The dying ask for water because they know it contains life.
cards.original_text: You gain 8 life.

cards.name: Wild Ox
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: It has the run of the swamps, and it knows it.
cards.original_text: Swampwalk (If defending player has any swamps in play, Wild Ox can't be blocked.)

cards.name: River Bear
cards.text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
cards.flavor: The bears had been isolated on an island for hundreds of years, until the island sank and the bears didn't.
cards.original_text: Islandwalk (If defending player has any islands in play, River Bear can't be blocked.)

cards.name: Barbtooth Wurm
cards.flavor: In its lair lies a carpet of bones.

cards.name: Ironhoof Ox
cards.text: Ironhoof Ox can't be blocked by more than one creature.
cards.flavor: The good news is it's vegetarian. The bad news is it just doesn't like you.
cards.original_text: Ironhoof Ox can't be blocked by more than one creature.

cards.name: Renewing Touch
cards.text: Shuffle any number of target creature cards from your graveyard into your library.
cards.flavor: Death just encourages life the more.
cards.original_text: Choose any number of creature cards in your graveyard and shuffle them into your library.

cards.name: Untamed Wilds
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.original_text: Search your library for a plains, island, swamp, mountain, or forest card and put that land into play. Shuffle your library afterwards.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
Can fetch a snow land.

cards.name: Deep Wood
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by attacking creatures.
cards.original_text:
Play Deep Wood only after you're attacked, before you declare blockers.
This turn, all damage dealt to you by attacking creatures is reduced to 0.

cards.name: Harmony of Nature
cards.text: Tap any number of untapped creatures you control. You gain 4 life for each creature tapped this way.
cards.original_text: Tap any number of your creatures. You gain 4 life for each creature tapped this way. (Tapped creatures can't block.)

cards.name: Bee Sting
cards.text: Bee Sting deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
Busy as a bumblebee, blistered as a goblin.
—Alaborn saying
cards.original_text: Bee Sting deals 2 damage to any one creature or player.

cards.name: Norwood Priestess
cards.text: {T}: You may put a green creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.original_text: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Norwood Priestess to put any green creature from your hand into play without paying for it.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.name: Sylvan Yeti
cards.text: Sylvan Yeti's power is equal to the number of cards in your hand.
cards.flavor: The deeper the wood, the greater its strength.
cards.original_text: Sylvan Yeti has power equal to the number of cards you have in your hand.

cards.name: Norwood Ranger
cards.flavor: Some trees bear deadly fruit.

cards.name: Deathcoil Wurm
cards.text: You may have Deathcoil Wurm assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
cards.original_text: If Deathcoil Wurm attacks and is blocked, you may choose to have it deal its damage to the defending player instead of to the creatures blocking it.

rulings.text: You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the player or planeswalker this creature is attacking. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

cards.name: Razorclaw Bear
cards.text: Whenever Razorclaw Bear becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
One razorclaw is three bears too many.
—Elvish saying
cards.original_text: If Razorclaw Bear attacks and is blocked, it gets +2/+2 until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Alluring Scent
cards.text: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.
cards.flavor: No earthly armor is protection against this sweetness.
cards.original_text: Choose any one creature. This turn, all creatures able to block it do so.

cards.name: Hurricane
cards.text: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.
cards.original_text: Hurricane deals X damage to each player and each creature with flying. (This includes you and your creatures with flying.)

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature has flying is only checked on resolution.

cards.original_text: U

cards.original_text: U

cards.original_text: B

cards.original_text: G

cards.original_text: G

cards.name: Sylvan Basilisk
cards.text: Whenever Sylvan Basilisk becomes blocked by a creature, destroy that creature.
cards.original_text: If Sylvan Basilisk attacks and is blocked, destroy all creatures blocking it. (Destroy the creatures before they deal damage. The Basilisk doesn't damage your opponent.)
